item.title: Why Your Next Wire Should Be Glass
item.description: By: John Shepler The telecommunications and computer networking industries were built upon copper wire technology. While technologies like Cat5e and Cat6 cabling are sufficient for many networking needs, it’s worth considering fiber optic solutions for your next connection. LAN vs. WAN Copper-based Ethernet is effective for short distances, making it suitable for internal networks. Most users don’t require speeds exceeding 1000 Mbps. Therefore, installing fiber to individual desktops seems excessive.
